options.name: all_proxy
options.desc: Overwrites the all_proxy environment variable for the Syncthing process to the given value. This is normally used to let Syncthing connect through a SOCKS5 proxy server. See https://docs.syncthing.net/users/proxying.html.

options.name: cert
options.desc: Path to the cert.pem file, which will be copied into Syncthing’s configDir.

options.name: configDir
options.desc: The path where the settings and keys will exist.

options.name: dataDir
options.desc: The path where synchronised directories will exist.

options.name: databaseDir
options.desc: The directory containing the database and logs.

options.name: enable
options.desc: Whether to enable Syncthing, a self-hosted open-source alternative to Dropbox and Bittorrent Sync.

options.name: extraFlags
options.desc: Extra flags passed to the syncthing command in the service definition.

options.name: group
options.desc: The group to run Syncthing under. By default, a group named syncthing will be created.

options.name: guiAddress
options.desc: The address to serve the web interface at.

options.name: key
options.desc: Path to the key.pem file, which will be copied into Syncthing’s configDir.

options.name: openDefaultPorts
options.desc: Whether to open the default ports in the firewall: TCP/UDP 22000 for transfers and UDP 21027 for discovery. If multiple users are running Syncthing on this machine, you will need to manually open a set of ports for each instance and leave this disabled. Alternatively, if you are running only a single instance on this machine using the default ports, enable this.

options.name: overrideDevices
options.desc: Whether to delete the devices which are not configured via the devices option. If set to false, devices added via the web interface will persist and will have to be deleted manually.

options.name: overrideFolders
options.desc: Whether to delete the folders which are not configured via the folders option. If set to false, folders added via the web interface will persist and will have to be deleted manually.

options.name: package
options.desc: The syncthing package to use.

options.name: relay.enable
options.desc: Whether to enable Syncthing relay service.

options.name: relay.extraOptions
options.desc: Extra command line arguments to pass to strelaysrv.

options.name: relay.globalRateBps
options.desc: Global bandwidth rate limit in bytes per second.

options.name: relay.listenAddress
options.desc: Address to listen on for relay traffic.

options.name: relay.perSessionRateBps
options.desc: Per session bandwidth rate limit in bytes per second.

options.name: relay.pools
options.desc: Relay pools to join. If null, uses the default global pool.

options.name: relay.port
options.desc: Port to listen on for relay traffic. This port should be added to networking.firewall.allowedTCPPorts.
options.type: 16 bit unsigned integer; between 0 and 65535 (both inclusive)

options.name: relay.providedBy
options.desc: Human-readable description of the provider of the relay (you).

options.name: relay.statusListenAddress
options.desc: Address to listen on for serving the relay status API.

options.name: relay.statusPort
options.desc: Port to listen on for serving the relay status API. This port should be added to networking.firewall.allowedTCPPorts.
options.type: 16 bit unsigned integer; between 0 and 65535 (both inclusive)

options.name: settings
options.desc: Extra configuration options for Syncthing. See https://docs.syncthing.net/users/config.html. Note that this attribute set does not exactly match the documented xml format. Instead, this is the format of the json rest api. There are slight differences. For example, this xml: <options>  <listenAddress>default</listenAddress>  <minHomeDiskFree unit="%">1</minHomeDiskFree> </options> corresponds to the json: {  options: {   listenAddresses = [    "default"   ];   minHomeDiskFree = {    unit = "%";    value = 1;   };  }; }

options.name: settings.devices
options.desc: Peers/devices which Syncthing should communicate with. Note that you can still add devices manually, but those changes will be reverted on restart if overrideDevices is enabled.

options.name: settings.devices.<name>.autoAcceptFolders
options.desc: Automatically create or share folders that this device advertises at the default path. See https://docs.syncthing.net/users/config.html?highlight=autoaccept#config-file-format.

options.name: settings.devices.<name>.id
options.desc: The device ID. See https://docs.syncthing.net/dev/device-ids.html.

options.name: settings.devices.<name>.name
options.desc: The name of the device.

options.name: settings.folders
options.desc: Folders which should be shared by Syncthing. Note that you can still add folders manually, but those changes will be reverted on restart if overrideFolders is enabled.

options.name: settings.folders.<name>.copyOwnershipFromParent
options.desc: On Unix systems, tries to copy file/folder ownership from the parent directory (the directory it’s located in). Requires running Syncthing as a privileged user, or granting it additional capabilities (e.g. CAP_CHOWN on Linux).

options.name: settings.folders.<name>.devices
options.desc: The devices this folder should be shared with. Each device must be defined in the devices option.

options.name: settings.folders.<name>.enable
options.desc: Whether to share this folder. This option is useful when you want to define all folders in one place, but not every machine should share all folders.

options.name: settings.folders.<name>.id
options.desc: The ID of the folder. Must be the same on all devices.

options.name: settings.folders.<name>.label
options.desc: The label of the folder.

options.name: settings.folders.<name>.path
options.desc: The path to the folder which should be shared. Only absolute paths (starting with /) and paths relative to the user’s home directory (starting with ~/) are allowed.

options.name: settings.folders.<name>.type
options.desc: Controls how the folder is handled by Syncthing. See https://docs.syncthing.net/users/config.html#config-option-folder.type.

options.name: settings.folders.<name>.versioning
options.desc: How to keep changed/deleted files with Syncthing. There are 4 different types of versioning with different parameters. See https://docs.syncthing.net/users/versioning.html.

options.name: settings.folders.<name>.versioning.type
options.desc: The type of versioning. See https://docs.syncthing.net/users/versioning.html.

options.name: settings.options
options.desc: The options element contains all other global configuration options

options.name: settings.options.limitBandwidthInLan
options.desc: Whether to apply bandwidth limits to devices in the same broadcast domain as the local device.

options.name: settings.options.localAnnounceEnabled
options.desc: Whether to send announcements to the local LAN, also use such announcements to find other devices.

options.name: settings.options.localAnnouncePort
options.desc: The port on which to listen and send IPv4 broadcast announcements to.

options.name: settings.options.maxFolderConcurrency
options.desc: This option controls how many folders may concurrently be in I/O-intensive operations such as syncing or scanning. The mechanism is described in detail in a separate chapter.

options.name: settings.options.relaysEnabled
options.desc: When true, relays will be connected to and potentially used for device to device connections.

options.name: settings.options.urAccepted
options.desc: Whether the user has accepted to submit anonymous usage data. The default, 0, mean the user has not made a choice, and Syncthing will ask at some point in the future. “-1” means no, a number above zero means that that version of usage reporting has been accepted.

options.name: systemService
options.desc: Whether to auto-launch Syncthing as a system service.

options.name: user
options.desc: The user to run Syncthing as. By default, a user named syncthing will be created whose home directory is dataDir.
